qas.question: What do students traditionally do at the beginning of each football game kickoff?
What football game tradition has since been discontinued?

answers.text: students would throw marshmallows during games

qas.question: What color does the Clock Tower glow after a winning football game?
What noise do students make when the opposing team has control of the football?
How long does the Clock Tower remain purple after a winning game?

answers.text: until a loss or until the end of the sports season

qas.question: What do students traditionally do at the beginning of each soccer game kickoff?

plausible_answers.text: students would throw marshmallows during games

qas.question: What soccer game tradition has since been discontinued?
What color does the Clock Tower glow after a winning soccer game?
What noise do students make when the opposing team has control of the soccer?

plausible_answers.text: until a loss or until the end of the sports season.

qas.question: How long does the Clock Tower remain white after a winning game?

context: There are traditions long associated with football games. Students <a3_0><b8_0>growl<b8_0/><a3_0/> like wildcats when the opposing team controls the ball, while simulating a paw with their hands. They will also <a0_0><b5_0>jingle keys<b5_0/><a0_0/> at the beginning of each kickoff. In the past, before the tradition was discontinued, <a1_0><b6_0>students would throw marshmallows during games<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The Clock Tower at the Rebecca Crown Center glows <a2_0><b7_0>purple<b7_0/><a2_0/>, instead of its usual white, after a winning game, thereby proclaiming the happy news. The Clock Tower remains purple <a4_0><b9_0>until a loss or until the end of the sports season<a4_0/>.<b9_0/> Whereas formerly the Clock Tower was lighted only for football victories, wins for men's basketball and women's lacrosse now merit commemoration as well; important victories in other sports may also prompt an empurpling.
